p: The World Health Organization has identified Aedes mosquitoes, for example, A. aegypti as the main vector of arbovirosis, which has adapted to environmental changes such as the increase of urbanizations. Unfortunately, the reduction of mosquito control programs that occurred during the 1960s did not have more resources, generating loss of expertise and infrastructure. With the epidemics of ZIKA and CHIKV reactive reactions, such as the use of spray and fumigations, have been presented, but these strategies are not sustainable, causing long-term resistances to many insecticides ( Rabaan et al., 2017).
